newsitem.title: USA: Diagnostic Health names Turner CFO.
newsitem.headline: Diagnostic Health names Turner CFO.

text.p: Diagnostic Health Services Inc said Tuesday that Christoper Turner was named chief financial officer and Mark Foley has joined the company as vice-president of sales and marketing.
Turner said the company takes over the title of CFO from Diagnostic health Services's president, Brad Hummel, who held both titles, while Foley's position is newly created.
Turner previosuly worked for the Texas firm of Phillip Vogel and the national public accounting firm, Grant Thornton, before founding Turner & Turner, PC.
Prior to joining DHS, Mark Foley was General Manager (Midwest Region) of the Diagnostic Services Division of National Medical Care Inc.
DHS is a provider of medical outsourcing services to hospitals, physicians' offices and other healthcare facilities.
